poem:
**Contours of Change**

In the hushed  
corner of the  
changing room,  
a reflection fractures—  
threads of identity  
woven tight, unravel.  
Under sterile lights,  
a boundary blurs,  
skin to skin,  
we stand,  
seeking a place  
among mirrors,  
where whispers  
become the fabric  
we wear.  
Harmony in   
unease,  
in the stitches  
we break and mend.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "NHS nurse’s tribunal over trans doctor’s use of changing room hears final evidence An employment tribunal brought by an NHS Fife nurse who objected to sharing a changing room with a transgender doctor has concluded its evidence with conflicting interpretations of how the supreme court’s landmark ruling on sex affects the case. Sandie Peggie, who has worked as a nurse for more than 30 years, contends she was subject to unlawful harassment under the Equality". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: NHS nurse’s tribunal over trans doctor’s use of changing room hears final evidence An employment tribunal brought by an NHS Fife nurse who objected to sharing a changing room with a transgender doctor has concluded its evidence with conflicting interpretations of how the supreme court’s landmark ruling on sex affects the case. Sandie Peggie, who has worked as a nurse for more than 30 years, contends she was subject to unlawful harassment under the Equality
